FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.label: Militaristic
FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.desc: A militaristic society, one who seeks glory in blood and death for their cause.

positiveEffects.li: - +20% combat modifier when using your faction's military forces
- Once per five days, you can deploy a second squad from a single settlement by paying 20% of the squad's cost in Silver
- When creating a new settlement, it will start with a Barracks
- All military buildings cost 100 less upkeep

FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.label: Pacifist
FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.desc: A pacifist society that seeks to avoid conflict when and where possible.

positiveEffects.li: - Once per five days, can send a diplomatic envoy to another faction to attempt to improve relations
- Deaths of members of your faction will not cause unrest to rise or happiness to reduce

negativeEffects.li: - Cannot use military forces to raid or to capture other faction's settlements

FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.label: Authoritarian
FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.desc: A authoritarian society that seeks to hold control over its members by whatever means necessary.

positiveEffects.li: - Can send your military to raid another faction's settlement to enslave members of their faction instead of ordinary raiding
- You can spend silver to increase the loyalty of a settlement

FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.label: Egalitarian
FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.desc: A egalatarian society is one that seeks equality amongst all.

positiveEffects.li: - Can reduce base tax by 20% for two tax periods to drastically boost happiness and prosperity
- Receives a base tax bonus of (1% per 10% happiness)

FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.label: Isolationist
FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.desc: An isolationist society is one that seeks to stay reclusive amongst the world's politics and interactions.

positiveEffects.li: - The time to upgrade settlements and construct buildings is reduced by 50%
- Every settlement receives an extra +3 to worker softcap per level of the settlement
- All settlements receive +10% to base tax

negativeEffects.li: - The cost to create new settlements is increased by 100%
- Cannot use your military forces to capture other faction's settlements

FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.label: Expansionist
FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.desc: An expansionist society is one that seeks to spread their glory across the entirety of the realm.

positiveEffects.li: - Your first settlement is free
- Once per year, starting after your first year, the cost to create a new settlement is reduced by 50%
- Settlements that you construct start at level 2

FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.label: Technocratic
FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.desc: A technocratic society is one that seeks the furthering of knowledge and continuous improvement.

positiveEffects.li: - All research produced by your settlements is doubled
- Can send items that you have not completed the research for or are above your tech level to your settlements to be reverse-engineered, giving you their value in research points

FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.label: Feudal
FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.desc: A feudal society is one that supports a feudal contract, binding the society to a liege in return for protection.

positiveEffects.li: - Once per season, can request for an experienced mercenary from your faction to join your colony
- All tithes received have their value increased by 20%

negativeEffects.li: - Failing to protect your settlements against a raid causes loyalty to drop significantly

FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.label: Slaver
FactionColonies.FCPolicyDef.desc: A Society that focuses on Slavery

positiveEffects.li: - Your Faction has been using Slaves for it's project since the start, gaining more worker at the cost of not being able to hire much normal citizen.
- +2 Base Workers
